title: Switzerland qualifies after tense 3-2 victory over Serbia
description: Switzerland advanced to the last 16 of the World Cup for the third tournament in a row after a 3-2 win over Serbia on Friday, December 2.

title: Cameroon upset Brazil, still eliminated from World Cup
description: Cameroon handed Brazil its first group-stage loss at the World Cup in 24 years Friday – a result that still allowed the five-time champions to win the group and eliminated the Africans.

title: Sun to go down on Elton John's final UK tour at Glastonbury
description: The British singer will bring the curtain down on his final UK tour with a debut performance at Glastonbury next June.

title: China begins to exit its controversial zero-Covid policy
description: After a week of exceptional protests, the authorities have announced a 'new phase' in the fight against the epidemic.

title: Russian political prisoner Aleksei Navalny is at war with the state machine
description: Defying orders to bow down, Mr. Navalny is responding with a judicial guerrilla war to defend his rights and continue his political struggle.

title: In Berlin, the history of a prisoner of war camp is  'rediscovered'
description: The Lichterfelde camp, where several thousand French prisoners were detained between 1940 and 1945, is in the limelight thanks to a real estate project threatening what remains.

title: War in Ukraine: A hopeless negotiation
description: Vladimir Putin has backed himself into a corner: Any territorial concession would represent a defeat for Russia and be a grievous personal embarrassment for the autocrat, notes Alain Frachon in his column.

title: Macron's state visit to the US in pictures
description: The French President arrived in the US on Tuesday for a state visit hosted by President Joe Biden during which disagreements about US-EU trade did not entirely overshadow the pomp and ceremony at the White House.

title: 110 km/h highway speed control is the minimum France can do for the climate
description: Rejected by the French government in 2020, when it was among the proposals of the citizens' climate convention, this top speed reduction is even more necessary two years later to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Raising a glass to the end of the hotel minibar in France
description: More and more hotels are abandoning these energy-hungry mini-refrigerators, which pose management problems and are less and less in line with guests' expectations.

title: In Nicaragua, 'the entire civil society has been criminalized'
description: Journalist Carlos Chamorro received an honorary degree in Paris on behalf of Dora Maria Tellez, a human rights activist now detained by Daniel Ortega's regime.

title: Friendly but uncompromising: Biden's tête-à-tête with Macron
description: On the second day of his state visit, the French president did not manage to extract any major concessions from his counterpart on the American anti-inflation plan, considered protectionist by Paris.

title: France's electricity supplier braces for possible power cuts this winter
description: Enedis, France's electricity grid operator, has already carried out simulated 'scheduled load shedding' exercises in preparation for potential power cuts to French homes.

title: In Kherson, Ukrainians and Russians fight over the 'gray zone' of the Dnipro river
description: Since Ukraine retook the city, Russian forces have moved to the other side of the river, which serves as a front line.

title: How former Australian PM Scott Morrison secretly gave himself five ministerial portfolios
description: During the Covid-19 pandemic, Mr. Morrison took over the functions of the Ministers of Home Affairs, Health, Treasury, Finance, and Industry, all without informing anyone.

title: Drug offers hope of eradicating sleeping sickness
description: The results of a trial published on Wednesday suggest that a single dose of acoziborole could treat this deadly disease, transmitted by the tsetse fly.

title: Kanye West no longer plans to buy right-wing social media app Parler
description: The rapper, who now goes by Ye, was also banned from Twitter early Friday after posting an antisemitic tweet.

title: Cayeux, Kohler, McKinsey: For Macron, the 'slow poison' of repeated scandals
description: In the span of one week, three cases in which public responsibilities and private interests appear to have been conflated have fueled the legal saga surrounding the government.

title: In the Calanques National Park, pre-booked visits will be extended until 2027
description: The reservation system set up during the summer of 2022 reduced the number of visitors to the Calanque de Sugiton by a factor of six. To better assess its environmental effects, it is being extended to cover the entire summer period.

title: Giorgia Meloni, 'il presidente' of the Council of Ministers
description: The semantic choice made by the Italian far-right leader illustrates her ambiguous position on the issue of the inclusion of women in a political sphere mainly dominated by male figures.

title: Coal-rich Poland faces coalless winter
description: Facing shortages and soaring prices, the country is being obliged to import coal on a massive scale from Colombia, South Africa, or Australia to meet household demand.

title: A journey through the 'crossroads of civilizations': Uzbekistan opens the doors to its treasures in Paris
description: Two exhibitions at the Louvre and the Arab World Institute want people to step inside the worlds of Samarkand and Bukhara, and discover some of the treasures that have never before left the country.

title: 'Water carriers', 'crowd warmers,' 'anti-stars': Teammates who allow top players to make the ultimate difference
description: Messi, Ronaldo, Neymar and Mbappé are obviously the stars of the 2022 World Cup. But Le Monde columnist Jérôme Latta points out that they couldn't do it without a strong team supporting them.

title: Death of Christine McVie, the quiet force behind Fleetwood Mac
description: The British singer and keyboardist who wrote hits such as "Don’t Stop" and "Little Lies" died on November 30, 2022, at the age of 79.

title: EU climate plan: Researchers warn about risk of "sacrificing" land for bioenergy
description: American and European researchers are asking the Commission to take better account of the risk of indirect deforestation associated to its measures encouraging the burning of biomass.

title: Court halts Trump's 'special master' review of documents seized at Mar-a-Lago
description: A unanimous federal appeals court on Thursday, December 1, halted a third-party review of documents seized from the former US president's Mar-a-Lago estate. The ruling removes a major obstacle to the investigation into the mishandling of government records from his time in the White House.

title: Ukraine to impose limitations on Russian-linked religious groups
description: The Ukrainian National security and defense council instructed its government on Thursday, December 1, to propose to the country's parliament a bill on proscribing activities by religious organizations affiliated with centers of influence in Russia.
